title: Einstein Field Equations
subtitle: Complete Step-by-Step Derivation

sections.title: Part 3: Length Contraction and Coordinate Transformations

steps.title: 3.1 Chain Rule for Coordinate Transformations
steps.explanation: How partial derivatives transform between coordinate systems
equation: \frac{\partial \phi}{\partial y^n} = \frac{\partial \phi}{\partial x^{m}} \frac{\partial x^{m}}{\partial y^{n}} + \frac{\partial \phi}{\partial x^{2}} \frac{\partial x^{n}}{\partial y^{r}}

steps.title: 3.2 Second Derivative Transformation
steps.explanation: General transformation law for second derivatives between coordinate systems

steps.title: 4.1 Types of Tensors

steps.title: 4.2 Vector Transformation (Contravariant)
steps.explanation: How vector components transform between coordinate systems

steps.title: 4.3 Work as Tensor Contraction
steps.explanation: Work is the dot product of force and displacement

steps.title: 4.4 Rank-2 Tensor Definition
steps.explanation: Tensors are fixed relationships between two vectors

steps.title: 4.5 Tensor Product Transformation
steps.explanation: Transform a tensor product from x to y coordinates
equation: A^m_y B^n_y = \sum_r \frac{\partial y^m}{\partial x^r} A^r_x \sum_s \frac{\partial y^n}{\partial x^s} B^s_x
= \sum_{r,s} \frac{\partial y^m}{\partial x^r} \frac{\partial y^n}{\partial x^s} A^r_x B^s_x

steps.title: 4.6 Contravariant Tensor Transformation
steps.explanation: General transformation law for contravariant rank-2 tensors

steps.title: 4.7 Covariant Tensor Transformation
steps.explanation: Transformation law for covariant (lower index) tensors

steps.title: 5.1 Distance Element in Curved Space
steps.explanation: Generalize the Pythagorean theorem using the metric tensor

steps.title: 5.2 Metric Tensor Definition
steps.explanation: The metric tensor g_mn encodes the geometry of spacetime

steps.title: 5.3 Coordinate Transformation of Differentials
steps.explanation: How coordinate differentials transform

steps.title: 5.4 Transformed Distance Element
steps.explanation: Substituting the transformation into the metric
equation: ds^2 = g_{mn} \sum_{r,s} \frac{\partial x^m}{\partial y^r} dy^r \frac{\partial x^n}{\partial y^s} dy^s
= \sum_{r,s} \left[ g_{mn} \frac{\partial x^m}{\partial y^r} \frac{\partial x^n}{\partial y^s} \right] dy^r dy_s

steps.title: 5.5 Metric in New Coordinates
steps.explanation: The metric in flat space transforms covariantly

sections.title: Part 6: Christoffel Symbols and Covariant Derivatives

steps.title: 6.1 Problem with Ordinary Derivatives
steps.explanation: Derivatives of tensors do not necessarily transform between frames of reference

steps.title: 6.2 Naive Tensor Derivative
steps.explanation: Attempting to define a tensor from the derivative

steps.title: 6.3 Expected Transformation
steps.explanation: What we would expect from a covariant tensor
equation: T_{mn}(y) = \sum_{r,s} \frac{\partial x^r}{\partial y^m} \frac{\partial x^s}{\partial y^n} T_{rs}(x)

steps.title: 6.4 Actual Derivative Transformation
steps.explanation: Apply chain rule to the derivative
equation: T_m(y) = \frac{\partial x^r}{\partial y^m} \frac{\partial x^s}{\partial y^r} T_{rs}(x)
= \frac{\partial x^r}{\partial y^m} \frac{\partial x^s}{\partial y^r} \frac{\partial V_r(x)}{\partial x^s}

steps.title: 6.5 Problematic Transformation
steps.explanation: The derivative doesn't transform as expected
equation: T_m(y) = \frac{\partial x^r}{\partial y^m} \frac{\partial V_r(x)}{\partial y^n} \neq \frac{\partial V_m(y)}{\partial y^n}

steps.title: 6.6 Product Rule Application
steps.explanation: Apply product rule to the transformation, only one index transforms correctly
equation: \frac{\partial V_m(y)}{\partial y^n} = \frac{\partial}{\partial y^n} \left( \frac{\partial x^r}{\partial y^m} V_r(x) \right)

steps.title: 6.7 Expanded Product Rule
steps.explanation: Using the product rule dAB = AdB + BdA
equation: \frac{\partial V_m(y)}{\partial y^n} = \frac{\partial x^r}{\partial y^m} \frac{\partial V_r(x)}{\partial y^n} + \frac{\partial}{\partial y^n} \left( \frac{\partial x^r}{\partial y^m} \right) V_r(x)

steps.title: 6.8 Introducing the Christoffel Symbol
steps.explanation: Define the Christoffel symbol to correct the transformation

steps.title: 6.9 Covariant Derivative Definition
steps.explanation: The covariant derivative properly transforms as a tensor

steps.title: 6.10 Covariant Derivative of Rank-2 Tensor
steps.explanation: Extend to higher rank tensors with one Christoffel symbol per index

steps.title: 6.11 Metric Compatibility
steps.explanation: The covariant derivative of the metric vanishes in flat space

steps.title: 6.12 Metric Covariant Derivative Expanded
steps.explanation: Apply the covariant derivative formula to the metric

steps.title: 6.13 Christoffel Symbol Formula
steps.explanation: Solve for the Christoffel symbols in terms of metric derivatives
equation: \boxed{\Gamma^a_{bc}(x) = \frac{1}{2} g^{ad} \left( \frac{\partial g_{bd}}{\partial x^c} + \frac{\partial g_{ab}}{\partial x^c} - \frac{\partial g_{ba}}{\partial x^d} \right)}

steps.title: 8.4 Taylor Expansion
steps.explanation: Expand the Lagrangian to first order in Îµ
equation: L(x, u, v) \approx L(x, y, y') + \frac{\partial L}{\partial y}(u-y) + \frac{\partial L}{\partial y'}(v-y')
= L(x, y, y') + \frac{\partial L}{\partial y} \epsilon \eta + \frac{\partial L}{\partial y'} \epsilon \eta'

steps.title: 8.5 First-Order Variation
steps.explanation: The action variation to first order in Îµ

steps.title: 8.6 Integration by Parts

equation: \int \frac{\partial L}{\partial y'} \eta' \, dx = \eta \frac{\partial L}{\partial y'} - \int \eta \frac{d}{dx}\left( \frac{\partial L}{\partial y'} \right) dx

steps.title: 8.7 Stationary Action Condition

equation: \eta \int^b_a \frac{\partial L}{\partial y'} \, dx = \frac{\partial L}{\partial y} \eta - \int_a^b \eta \frac{d}{dx}\left( \frac{\partial L}{\partial y'} \right) dx
